intro: Watsonia lepida, commonly known as the purple firecracker lily, is a striking perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, upright stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant purple and red flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its foliage consists of long, grass-like leaves that form a dense basal rosette. Watsonia lepida is well-suited for rock gardens and sunny borders due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
